intro: Eriogonum annuum, commonly known as the annual buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Eriogonum annuum is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to arid environments.
